result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua A. Mitch

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 10:05am
INCLUDES 13CF925 & 15CF1176
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher.  Deft appears in person, in custody, with Atty John Bliss.
  
States says defendant does not meet regular standards of OWI court
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.
State moves to:
13CF925:
Ct. 2 Operating w/PAC (5th or 6th) >> dimissed outright
Ct. 3 Operating while revoked (rev due to alc/contr subst) >> D&RI
15CF1176:
Ct. 1 Bail Jumping- Felony >> D&RI
COURT grants above

PLEA:
13CF925:
Ct. 1 OWI (5th or 6th) >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: w/hold sentencing. 3 years probation. CONDITONS: Pay $3,214.00 fine inclusive of court costs. Pay DNA sample and surcharge, if not already completed. Serve 1 year MCJ with huber release for work or work search if meets jail critereia. 262 days credit granted for the 1 year jail sentence. 36 months driver's license revocation, granted any administrive credit for any time already served. 36 months IID to be intsalled immediately, time will not begin until deft obtain's valid license. 6 points assessed against driving record. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol. 

Adj: 10:20am

and Demand for Discovery & Inspection (w/cover letter)

Case Called: 8:48am

Deft wishes to proceed with bond modification in 13CF925

COURT addresses deft statement
State gives reasons why not to modify bond
COURT denies bond modification request
